intro: Hippagrostis undulatifolia, commonly known as the wavy-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped, wavy-edged leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
